plaintiff.name: Sarah Elizabeth Rodriguez
plaintiff.residency_details: Plaintiff is a resident of Brooklyn, New York
plaintiff.consumer_status: Individual 'consumer' within the meaning of both the Federal FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a(c), and the New York Fair Credit Reporting Act, N.Y. GBL § 380-a(a)

plaintiff_counsel.name: Michael J. Thompson
plaintiff_counsel.address: 500 Fifth Avenue, Suite 2100, New York, NY 10110

defendants.name: EQUIFAX INFORMATION SERVICES LLC
defendants.business_status: engaged in the business of assembling and evaluating consumer credit information

defendants.name: EXPERIAN INFORMATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
defendants.business_status: engaged in the business of assembling and evaluating consumer credit information

defendants.name: TRANS UNION LLC
defendants.business_status: engaged in the business of assembling and evaluating consumer credit information

defendants.name: CHASE BANK USA, N.A.
defendants.business_status: furnisher of information to consumer reporting agencies

defendants.name: CAPITAL ONE BANK (USA), N.A.
defendants.business_status: furnisher of information to consumer reporting agencies

factual_background.summary: Plaintiff Sarah Rodriguez has been the victim of multiple FCRA violations by defendant credit reporting agencies and furnishers. Despite multiple disputes and reinvestigation requests, defendants have willfully and negligently failed to correct inaccurate and unverifiable information on her credit reports, causing substantial damages to her credit rating, reputation, and financial opportunities.

events.description: Plaintiff discovered inaccurate late payment entries on her credit reports from Chase Bank and Capital One Bank that she never incurred
Plaintiff filed comprehensive written disputes with all three credit reporting agencies, providing detailed documentation proving the accounts were never delinquent
All three CRAs completed their 'reinvestigations' and verified the inaccurate information without conducting any meaningful investigation
Plaintiff filed second round of disputes with additional documentation, including bank statements and payment records
CRAs again verified the inaccurate information, failing to conduct reasonable reinvestigations as required by federal and state law
Plaintiff applied for mortgage refinancing and was denied due to the inaccurate credit reporting, despite having excellent payment history
Plaintiff applied for business loan and was offered significantly higher interest rates due to the false derogatory information
Plaintiff filed third round of disputes with certified mail and comprehensive evidence package
CRAs once again verified the inaccurate information without proper investigation, demonstrating willful non-compliance

investigation_failures: Failed to contact plaintiff for additional information
Conducted automated verification without human review
Failed to investigate with furnishers adequately

causes_of_action.title: FIRST CAUSE OF ACTION - WILLFUL VIOLATION OF FCRA (15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a))

allegations.description: Willful failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of Plaintiff's multiple comprehensive disputes concerning inaccurate information
Willful failure to review and consider all relevant information submitted by Plaintiff during reinvestigations
Willful failure to delete or modify inaccurate, incomplete, and unverifiable information from Plaintiff's credit files

causes_of_action.title: SECOND CAUSE OF ACTION - NEGLIGENT VIOLATION OF FCRA (15 U.S.C. § 1681i(a))

allegations.description: Negligent failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigations of disputed information within 30 days
Negligent failure to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of credit report information

causes_of_action.title: THIRD CAUSE OF ACTION - WILLFUL VIOLATION OF FCRA (15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(b))

allegations.description: Willful failure to conduct reasonable investigations after receiving notice of disputes from credit reporting agencies
Willful failure to review all relevant information provided by credit reporting agencies during dispute investigations

causes_of_action.title: FOURTH CAUSE OF ACTION - NEGLIGENT VIOLATION OF FCRA (15 U.S.C. § 1681s-2(b))

allegations.description: Negligent failure to conduct reasonable investigations of disputed information after receiving notice from CRAs

causes_of_action.title: FIFTH CAUSE OF ACTION - VIOLATION OF NEW YORK FCRA (N.Y. GBL § 380-f)

allegations.description: Failure to conduct reasonable reinvestigation of disputed erroneous information as required by New York state law
Failure to delete or modify disputed information that could not be verified after reinvestigation
Reporting information defendants knew or had reason to believe was inaccurate

damages.summary: As a direct and proximate result of Defendants' willful and negligent violations of the FCRA and NY FCRA, Plaintiff has suffered and continues to suffer substantial actual damages, including but not limited to: damage to credit rating and reputation, denial of credit and mortgage refinancing, higher interest rates on approved credit, emotional distress, humiliation, anxiety, frustration, loss of sleep, expenditure of time and resources attempting to correct her credit reports, and other consequential damages.

items: Higher interest rates on existing credit accounts
Denial of mortgage refinancing resulting in $12,000 annual additional interest
Increased insurance premiums due to credit-based scoring
Loss of favorable employment opportunities requiring credit checks
Costs associated with credit monitoring services
Damage to credit rating and reputation
Loss of sleep and peace of mind
Hundreds of hours spent disputing inaccurate information
Costs of certified mail and documentation
Time lost from work for dispute-related activities

denials.impact: Offered higher interest rate (8.5% instead of 5.2%)

declaratory_relief: Declaration that Defendants violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act
Declaration that Defendants violated the New York Fair Credit Reporting Act
injunctive_relief: Permanent injunction requiring Defendants to delete all inaccurate information from Plaintiff's credit files
Injunction requiring Defendants to implement proper procedures for conducting reasonable reinvestigations
Injunction requiring Defendants to comply with all provisions of federal and state FCRA
monetary_relief: Statutory damages under 15 U.S.C. § 1681n of $100 to $1,000 per violation for willful non-compliance
Punitive damages under federal and state law
Costs and reasonable attorney's fees under 15 U.S.C. § 1681n and N.Y. GBL §§ 380-l, 380-m

attorney_signature_block.address: 500 Fifth Avenue, Suite 2100, New York, NY 10110
